SkillsHints.Brawl: Exerting physical force. Used for Grapples, Shoves, and attacks with Brawl Weapons.
SkillsHints.Craft: Your skill to appraise and make Items.
SkillsHints.Finesse: Coordination and concealing your actions. Also used for thievery, and when attacking with Finesse Weapons.
SkillsHints.Influence: Social ability of coercion, deception, or negotiation.
SkillsHints.Performance: Cultural talent and ability to inspire awe.
SkillsHints.Survival: Tracking and a knowledge of beasts, plants, and other aspects of nature.

WeaponSkillsHints.Brawl: Exerting physical force. Used for Grapples, Shoves, and attacks with Brawl Weapons.
WeaponSkillsHints.Finesse: Coordination and concealing your actions. Also used for thievery, and when attacking with Finesse Weapons.

Hints.HP: Max Hit Points equal to Might × Level.
Hints.LuckPool: Total Luck points. Spend to gain Favor, reroll dice, or use Plot Armor.
Hints.Inventory: Carrying capacity equal to 8 + Might slots.
Hints.Speed: Movement distance in feet on solid ground.
Hints.MaxMana: Maximum mana points equal to Mana Multiplier × Key Stat.
Hints.ManaPerCast: The maximum Mana allowed per single spell cast.

Saves.NPCNoSaves: NPCs don't roll saves - they only have armor, immunities, and weaknesses.

Reflex.name: Reflex
Reflex.description: Evade physical harm, such as explosions, quick traps, slipping grasp, and dragon’s breath.

Endure.name: Endure
Endure.description: Withstand physical harm, such as poisons, extreme heat, restraints, and petrification.

Will.name: Will
Will.description: Resist mental harm, such as charms, dreadful terrors, psychic enthrallment, and your resolve.

DefendMechanics.BlockDescription: Roll Endure save. Success ignores one highest damage die. Hindered if Ranged attack.
DefendMechanics.DodgeDescription: Roll Reflex save. Success ignores one highest damage die. Hindered if Heavy Armor.
DefendMechanics.CritDescription: You aren't affected by what provoked the Save, and can use an Action.

Hints.Climb: Moves at full Speed while climbing. Beings without it are Vulnerable while climbing.
Hints.Cling: As Climb, but it can also Move on ceilings.
Hints.Fly: Can Move through the air at full Speed.
Hints.Phase: Can Move in occupied space, but is forced out to the nearest open space and takes 5 damage if it ends its Turn in occupied space.
Hints.Swim: Moves at full Speed while swimming. Beings without it are Vulnerable while in liquid deeper than half their height.

StatusConditionDescriptions.Dazed: Can't Focus or Move unless uses an Action. Speed = 0 [PARTIAL - Speed automated]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Dead: Same as Incapacitated but automatically fails ALL rolls (stats, skills, saves, attacks) [FULLY AUTOMATED]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Fatigued: Each Fatigue occupies an Item Slot. At 3+: can't Rush. At 5: dies [PARTIAL - Slots automated]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Prone: Costs 10' Speed to stand. Crawl only (2:1 ratio), can't Rush, Vulnerable [PARTIAL - Speed automated]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Confused: Checks/Saves Hindered. Saves against its Actions Favored [AUTOMATED]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Vulnerable: Its attacks and its Saves against attacks have Hinder. Attacks targeting it and Saves against its attacks have Favor [AUTOMATED]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Incapacitated: Can't Focus/Actions/Move. Auto-fail Might/Dex. Vulnerable. Speed = 0 [AUTOMATED]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Unconscious: Blinded + Incapacitated + Prone. Close Attacks auto-crit [AUTOMATED]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Invisible: Can't be seen. Attackers act as Blinded [AUTOMATED]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Berserk: It can’t take the Cast Action or Focus, it can’t be Frightened, and it doesn’t make Morale Checks [PARTIAL - Manual tracking]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Burning: Takes damage at start of turn [FUTURE - Requires combat tracker hooks]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Charmed: Can't willingly attack the charmer [FUTURE - Requires target validation]
StatusConditionDescriptions.Suffocating: After 1 minute: Heroes roll d8 vs Might for fatigue. Enemies gain 1 fatigue [FUTURE - Requires combat tracker]

rollDamageWithCheck.name: Roll Damage With Check
rollDamageWithCheck.hint: Roll damage together with attack/spell checks instead of waiting for confirmation. When disabled, a manual damage button will appear in chat.

alwaysRollDamage.name: Always Roll Damage
alwaysRollDamage.hint: When rolling damage with checks, roll damage even on misses (to show the intensity of the miss). Only applies when 'Roll Damage With Check' is enabled.

autoApplySaveDamage.name: Auto-Apply Save Damage
autoApplySaveDamage.hint: When enabled, damage is automatically applied to HP after save rolls. When disabled, damage amounts are shown in chat but must be applied manually.

defaultClockPosition.name: Default Clock Position
defaultClockPosition.hint: Default corner position for new progress clocks.

levelPacing.name: Level Pacing
levelPacing.hint: Controls how much XP is required to level up. This affects the pace of character progression throughout your campaign.

chatCardIconStyle.name: Chat Card Icon Style
chatCardIconStyle.hint: Choose what icon appears on the chat card
chatCardIconStyle.smart: Actor Face for Attacks/Spells, Item Icon for Gear

statusEffectsMode.name: Status Conditions Mode
statusEffectsMode.hint: Choose which status conditions appear in the token HUD menu. Vagabond mode shows all 17 system-specific conditions from the rulebook. Foundry mode shows all default conditions. Requires world reload to apply.

encounterSettings.name: Encounter Settings
encounterSettings.label: Configure Encounter
encounterSettings.hint: Configure combat encounter display options and mechanics.

compendiumSettings.name: Character Builder Compendiums
compendiumSettings.label: Manage Compendiums
compendiumSettings.hint: Choose which Item compendiums are available in the Character Builder.

hideInitiativeRoll.name: Hide Initiative Roll
hideInitiativeRoll.hint: Hide the initiative button in the combat tracker. The Vagabond system uses popcorn initiative and typically doesn't require traditional initiative rolls.

useActivationPoints.name: Use Activation Points
useActivationPoints.hint: Display activation counters below the play buttons. When disabled, combatants have one activation by default (as currently implemented).

defaultActivationPoints.name: Default Activation Points
defaultActivationPoints.hint: The starting number of activation points for each combatant when combat begins. Most tables use 1, but you may want 2 or more to track multiple actions like Movement and Attack, or Movement and Cast.

initiativeFormula.name: Initiative Formula (Player Characters)
initiativeFormula.hint: Custom formula for rolling initiative for PCs. Only used when initiative rolls are enabled. Use @ to reference actor data (e.g., @dexterity.value, @awareness.value).

npcInitiativeFormula.name: Initiative Formula (NPCs)
npcInitiativeFormula.hint: Custom formula for rolling initiative for NPCs. Only used when initiative rolls are enabled. Use @ to reference actor data (e.g., @speed).

pcFatigueMax.name: PC Fatigue Max
pcFatigueMax.hint: Maximum fatigue level for player characters. Each fatigue occupies an inventory slot. Default is 5.

npcFatigueMax.name: NPC Fatigue Max
npcFatigueMax.hint: Maximum fatigue level for NPCs. Default is 5.

MoraleCheck.Title: Morale Check
MoraleCheck.tooltip:
Check Morale (2d6 vs Morale)

When to roll:
• Their Leader is defeated.
• They are alone and at half HP or lower.
• Half or more are defeated.
MoraleCheck.Passed: Morale holds! The NPC continues fighting.
MoraleCheck.NoMorale: This NPC has no Morale value set.

increase.label: Increase Effect
increase.hint: How spending additional Mana improves this spell

type.label: Choice Type
type.hint: What type of choice does this perk require from the player?

selected.label: Selected Choice
selected.hint: The choice made by the player (automatically filled)

targetField.label: Target Field
targetField.hint: Which system field to modify. Use {choice} as placeholder for the selected value.

effectMode.label: Effect Mode
effectMode.hint: How the effect value is applied (Add, Override, etc.)

effectValue.label: Effect Value
effectValue.hint: The value to apply (can be a formula like @attributes.level.value)

ChoiceType.Label: Choice Type
ChoiceType.Hint: What type of choice does this perk require?

Perk.PrereqTypeTrainedSkillOrGroup: Trained Skill OR Group (e.g., Melee or Ranged)
Perk.PrereqTypeSpellOrGroup: Spell OR Group (e.g., Burn or Erupt)
Perk.PrereqTypeResourceOrGroup: Resource OR Group (e.g., Max Mana 7+ or Wealth 500s+)

StarterPack.NoItems: No items in this pack yet. Drag items here to add them.

TypeHints.Oil: Coats a Weapon, up to 5 ammo, a 5-foot square, or a Small to Large Being. Coating lasts one Shift, or until another oil is applied.
TypeHints.Poison: Affect a Target that is subjected to it in indicated ways. A weapon coated with it remains coated until it hits with an Attack or up to a Shift (whichever comes first).
TypeHints.Potion: Concoctions that cause magical effects when consumed.

ApplicationMode.Label: Application Mode
ApplicationMode.PermanentHint: This effect is always active. Use for perks, permanent buffs, or equipped armor bonuses that don't require the item to be actively used.
ApplicationMode.WhenEquippedHint: This effect only applies while the item is equipped (weapons, armor, accessories). The effect turns off when unequipped.
ApplicationMode.OnUseHint: This effect only applies when making rolls WITH this specific item. Use for weapon properties (Keen, Brutal), spell modifiers, or item-specific bonuses.

GripDescriptions.F: Fist: Your hands are open while using it.
GripDescriptions.V: Versatile: Counts as 1H, but its damage die is one size larger if 2H.

PropertyHints.Brawl: Unarmed weapon usable with Brawl skill.
PropertyHints.Cleave: Can deal half damage to two Targets.
PropertyHints.Entangle: On hit, target is Entangled until end of their next turn.
PropertyHints.Finesse: Can use Dexterity instead of Might for attack rolls.
PropertyHints.Keen: Critical hit on 19-20 instead of just 20.
PropertyHints.Long: Extended reach, can attack from 10ft away.
PropertyHints.Shield: Ignores Hinder from Blocking Ranged Attacks. Can Shove (manual play).
PropertyHints.Thrown: Can be thrown as a ranged attack.

MetalDescriptions.Adamant: Occupies +1 Slot. +1 to Armor (if Armor) or Weapon damage.

Tooltips.none: Click to toggle Favor/Hinder. Currently no modifier applied.
Tooltips.favor: Favor: +1d6 to all d20 rolls. Click to switch to Hinder.
Tooltips.hinder: Hinder: -1d6 from all d20 rolls. Click to switch to None.

CharBuilder.Title: Character Builder
CharBuilder.AssignStats: Drag and drop the values in the Stats below to assign:

Instructions.Ancestry: Choose your Ancestry. It grants you Traits shared by every member of that Ancestry, such as their Type and Size.
Instructions.Class: Select a Class. They grant Training and Features, and provides a guide for how the Hero best perform in Combat.
Instructions.Stats: Select a Stat array from the list on the left to begin assigning values on top.
Instructions.Spells: If your class or ancestry allows, choose your starting spells. Spells can create devastating and miraculous effects.
Instructions.Perks: Check your starting perks. Perks are marks of achievement and signals of arcs in one's life journey.
Instructions.StartingPacks: You can choose any pack you like, but there are recommended Starter Packs in your class Playing section
Instructions.Gear: You can spend your remaining silver on additional equipment, weapons, and supplies.

CharBuilder.TrayInstructions: Drag items from the list or click 'Add to Tray' to collect your choices.
CharBuilder.TrayEmpty: Your tray is empty. Select items from the list and drop it here.

Confirmation.CloseContent: Are you sure you want to close the builder? All unsaved progress will be lost.

CharBuilder.FinishMessage: Your Vagabond is ready! Remember to double-check your Features and Traits on your new sheet to ensure you've manually added all promised Perks and Spells.
